# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(join(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The above function `wrap_string` will take a string `text` and an optional `text_width` (defaulting to 10), and it will return a wrapped version of the text with each line respecting the maximum width specified by `text_width`. The function works by iterating over the words in the text and appending them to a list of lines, adding a new line whenever the total length of the current line plus the word exceeds the `text_width` limit.
